intro: Brassica leptopetala, commonly known as the slender-flowered mustard, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It is a member of the Brassicaceae family, characterized by its small, four-petaled flowers and capsule fruits. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, with hairy stems and alternate, lance-shaped leaves. Its flowers are usually pale yellow or greenish-white, and it blooms from late spring to early summer. Brassica leptopetala is adapted to cold climates and is often found in alpine or rocky habitats.
